member.name: T:Lidgren.Network.NetClient
member.summary: Specialized version of NetPeer used for a "client" connection. It does not accept any incoming connections and maintains a ServerConnection property

member.summary: Represents a local peer capable of holding zero, one or more connections to remote peers

member.summary: Gets the NetPeerStatus of the NetPeer

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeer.MessageReceivedEvent
member.summary: Signalling event which can be waited on to determine when a message is queued for reading. Note that there is no guarantee that after the event is signaled the blocked thread will find the message in the queue. Other user created threads could be preempted and dequeue the message before the waiting thread wakes up.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeer.UniqueIdentifier
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for this NetPeer based on Mac address and ip/port. Note! Not available until Start() has been called!

member.summary: Gets the port number this NetPeer is listening and sending on, if Start() has been called

member.name: T:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration
member.summary: Partly immutable after NetPeer has been initialized

member.summary: NetPeerConfiguration constructor

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.EnableMessageType(Lidgren.Network.NetIncomingMessageType)
member.summary: Enables receiving of the specified type of message

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.DisableMessageType(Lidgren.Network.NetIncomingMessageType)
member.summary: Disables receiving of the specified type of message

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.SetMessageTypeEnabled(Lidgren.Network.NetIncomingMessageType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables receiving of the specified type of message

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.IsMessageTypeEnabled(Lidgren.Network.NetIncomingMessageType)
member.summary: Gets if receiving of the specified type of message is enabled

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.Clone
member.summary: Creates a memberwise shallow clone of this configuration

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.AppIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier of this application; the library can only connect to matching app identifier peers

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.NetworkThreadName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the library network thread. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.MaximumConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of connections this peer can hold. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.MaximumTransmissionUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of bytes to send in a single packet, excluding ip, udp and lidgren headers

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.DefaultOutgoingMessageCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the default capacity in bytes when NetPeer.CreateMessage() is called without argument

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.PingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time between latency calculating pings

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.UseMessageRecycling
member.summary: Gets or sets if the library should recycling messages to avoid excessive garbage collection. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds timeout will be postponed on a successful ping/pong

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.EnableUPnP
member.summary: Enables UPnP support; enabling port forwarding and getting external ip

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.LocalAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the local ip address to bind to. Defaults to IPAddress.Any. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.BroadcastAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the broadcast address to bind to. Defaults to IPAddress.Broadcast. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the local port to bind to. Defaults to 0. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.ReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in bytes of the receiving buffer. Defaults to 131071 bytes. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.SendBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in bytes of the sending buffer. Defaults to 131071 bytes. Cannot be changed once NetPeer is initialized.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.AcceptIncomingConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets if the NetPeer should accept incoming connections. This is automatically set to true in NetServer and false in NetClient.

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.ResendHandshakeInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds between handshake attempts

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.MaximumHandshakeAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of handshake attempts before failing to connect

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.AutoExpandMTU
member.summary: Gets or sets if the NetPeer should send large messages to try to expand the maximum transmission unit size

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.ExpandMTUFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets how often to send large messages to expand MTU if AutoExpandMTU is enabled

member.name: P:Lidgren.Network.NetPeerConfiguration.ExpandMTUFailAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of failed expand mtu attempts to perform before setting final MTU

members.member:
A fast random number generator for .NET Colin Green, January 2005
September 4th 2005 Added NextBytesUnsafe() - commented out by default. Fixed bug in Reinitialise() - y,z and w variables were not being reset.
Key points: 1) Based on a simple and fast xor-shift pseudo random number generator (RNG) specified in: Marsaglia, George. (2003). Xorshift RNGs. http://www.jstatsoft.org/v08/i14/xorshift.pdf
This particular implementation of xorshift has a period of 2^128-1. See the above paper to see how this can be easily extened if you need a longer period. At the time of writing I could find no information on the period of System.Random for comparison.
2) Faster than System.Random. Up to 8x faster, depending on which methods are called.
3) Direct replacement for System.Random. This class implements all of the methods that System.Random does plus some additional methods. The like named methods are functionally equivalent.
4) Allows fast re-initialisation with a seed, unlike System.Random which accepts a seed at construction time which then executes a relatively expensive initialisation routine. This provides a vast speed improvement if you need to reset the pseudo-random number sequence many times, e.g. if you want to re-generate the same sequence many times. An alternative might be to cache random numbers in an array, but that approach is limited by memory capacity and the fact that you may also want a large number of different sequences cached. Each sequence can each be represented by a single seed value (int) when using FastRandom.
Notes. A further performance improvement can be obtained by declaring local variables as static, thus avoiding re-allocation of variables on each call. However care should be taken if multiple instances of FastRandom are in use or if being used in a multi-threaded environment.

member.name: F:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.Instance
member.summary: Gets a global NetRandom instance

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.#ctor
member.summary: Initialises a new instance using time dependent seed.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance using an int value as seed. This constructor signature is provided to maintain compatibility with System.Random

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.GetSeed(System.Object)
member.summary: Create a semi-random seed based on an object

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.Reinitialise(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reinitialises using an int value as a seed.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.Next
member.summary:
Generates a random int over the range 0 to int.MaxValue-1. MaxValue is not generated in order to remain functionally equivalent to System.Random.Next(). This does slightly eat into some of the performance gain over System.Random, but not much. For better performance see:
Call NextInt() for an int over the range 0 to int.MaxValue.
Call NextUInt() and cast the result to an int to generate an int over the full Int32 value range including negative values.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a random int over the range 0 to upperBound-1, and not including upperBound.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.Next(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a random int over the range lowerBound to upperBound-1, and not including upperBound. upperBound must be >= lowerBound. lowerBound may be negative.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextDouble
member.summary: Generates a random double. Values returned are from 0.0 up to but not including 1.0.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextSingle
member.summary: Generates a random single. Values returned are from 0.0 up to but not including 1.0.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fills the provided byte array with random bytes. This method is functionally equivalent to System.Random.NextBytes().

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextUInt
member.summary:
Generates a uint. Values returned are over the full range of a uint, uint.MinValue to uint.MaxValue, inclusive.
This is the fastest method for generating a single random number because the underlying random number generator algorithm generates 32 random bits that can be cast directly to a uint.

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextInt
member.summary:
Generates a random int over the range 0 to int.MaxValue, inclusive. This method differs from Next() only in that the range is 0 to int.MaxValue and not 0 to int.MaxValue-1.
The slight difference in range means this method is slightly faster than Next() but is not functionally equivalent to System.Random.Next().

member.name: M:Lidgren.Network.NetRandom.NextBool
member.summary: Generates a single random bit. This method's performance is improved by generating 32 bits in one operation and storing them ready for future calls.
